articles.title: Single-minded Unity of Korea Praised
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays Marked in Bangladesh 
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi preparatory committee for commemorating the April holiday published a special bulletin on Apr. 4 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the 13th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 74th anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
 Noting that President Kim Il Sung performed immortal feats for the era and history, made a great contribution to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence and received many orders, medals and honorary titles from different countries and international organizations, the bulletin highly praised his personality as a great man.
 It said that Kim Jong Il resolutely smashed the moves of the U.S. and its allied imperialist forces to isolate and stifle the DPRK with his unique Songun politics and successfully defended the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation. It praised the heroic Korean People's Army holding him in high esteem as the supreme commander for winning victory after victory.

articles.title: Events Held to Mark Kim Jong Il's Election as NDC Chairman

U.S. Offensive to Stifle DPRK Flailed in S. Korea
24th April Spring Friendship Art Festival Opens
articles.content:
U.S. Offensive to Stifle DPRK Flailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Reunification Solidarity of south Korea reportedly held a press conference near Kwanghwamun in Seoul on April 5 to denounce the ever-more undisguised offensive of the United States to stifle the DPRK.
 Figures from different organizations under the Reunification Solidarity made speeches to be followed by the recital of a press release. It accused the U.S. of spreading sheer lies to tighten financial sanctions against the north while putting the brake on the affairs of the Kaesong Industrial Zone. The real criminal state is the U.S. which has interfered with the north's economic activities by setting afloat fictions, it noted, and continued:
 The U.S. offensive to stifle the DPRK is a quite dangerous act to totally scuttle the six-party talks and drive the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war. Dialogue is incompatible with pressure.    
 If the U.S. has the willingness to seek a peaceful settlement to the "Korean Peninsula" issue, it should stop the offensive at once and sincerely implement the joint statement adopted at the fourth round of the six-party talks.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Government Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation 
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Chinese government cultural delegation on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was handed to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Ding Wei, assistant to the minister of Culture who is heading the delegation, on Monday.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Immortal Exploits in Environmental Protection
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Government Delegation
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday met and had a friendly conversation with the Chinese government cultural delegation led by Ding Wei, assistant to the minister of Culture, at the People's Palace of Culture.
 On hand were Jon Hyon Chan, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and Zhang Yongwen, cultural councilor of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Colorfully Decorated Flower Festival Venue
2006-2008 Plan for Cultural Exchange between DPRK and China Inked
Banquet for Participants in Art Festival
articles.content:
2006-2008 Plan for Cultural Exchange between DPRK and China Inked
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The 2006-2008 plan for cultural exchange between the governments of the DPRK and China was signed here on Monday.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Jon Hyon Chan, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and other officials concerned and from the Chinese side the members of the Chinese government cultural delegation headed by Ding Wei, assistant to the minister of Culture, and Zhang Yongwen, cultural councilor of the Chinese embassy here.
 The plan was signed by Jon Hyon Chan and Ding Wei.

articles.content:
Banquet for Participants in Art Festival
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee of the 24th April Spring Friendship Art Festival gave a banquet for the participants in the festival at the Yanggakdo International Hotel Sunday.
 Invited to the banquet were foreign artistes, overseas Korean artistes and delegations.
 On hand were Minister of Culture Kim Jin Song who is chairman of the festival organizing committee, vice-chairmen of the organizing committee and officials concerned.
 A speech was made at the banquet.
